snippet: Fewer people turned out compared with the June wave of mass protests, pointing to the way that the flare-up of public ire over corruption has given way to more fragmented movements.
abstract: Thousands of people protesting government corruption in cities across Brazil disrupt military parades commemorating country’s independence.

byline.contributor: Paula Ramon contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil; Lucy Jordan from Brasília; and Taylor Barnes from Rio de Janeiro.

lead_paragraph: Fewer people turned out compared with the June wave of mass protests, pointing to the way that the flare-up of public ire over corruption has given way to more fragmented movements.

headline.main: Protests Fill City Streets Across Brazil
headline.print_headline: Protests Fill City Streets Across Brazil
